verb.description: Carry out (a task) badly or carelessly.
examples: the ability to take on any task without botching it
he was in a position to hire people, and he botched that up

noun.description: A bungled or badly carried out task or action.
examples: I've probably made a botch of things

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense repair but originally not implying clumsiness): of unknown origin.
